section_title: Arthroscopically Assisted Lysis of Adhesions (Evidence: pg no: 10, L490)
names: Arthroscopically assisted lysis of adhesions (Evidence: pg no: 10, L490)
description: Arthroscopically assisted lysis of adhesions for post-traumatic, post-surgical, or idiopathic stiffness (Evidence: pg no: 10, L491-L496)
scope: Treatment of knee stiffness (Evidence: pg no: 10, L490-L496)

documentation: Physical exam demonstrates limited range of motion of knee, defined as less than 105 degrees of flexion or flexion contracture greater than 10 degrees (Evidence: pg no: 10, L493-L494)
Range of motion has failed to improve despite 6 weeks of conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 10, L495)
Failure of prior manipulation under anesthesia or manipulation under anesthesia is planned concurrently (Evidence: pg no: 10, L496)
